definition: structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: He had the satisfaction of seeing his book become a best-seller.
sentences.chinese: 看到自己的作品成了暢銷書，他志得意滿。

sentences.english: Time has become Death triumphant over all.
sentences.chinese: 時間變成了無處不在的志得意滿的死亡。

definition: standing above the common crowd (idiom); outstanding/excellent and unrivaled
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
lit. to bring a bramble and ask for punishment (idiom)/fig. to offer sb a humble apology
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
wine, sex, avarice and temper (idiom); four cardinal vices
